main event: A pilot observed a light descending in the Atlantic Ocean on 22 July 1951.
interesting points: The pilot expressed uncertainty regarding the accuracy of his observation, suggesting that the light might have been from 15,000 ft.,The light was described as brilliant white and seemed to disappear into overcast clouds,No other aircraft or vessels were found in the area during the sighting,The sighting led to an investigation by a dispatched aircraft,The incident was deemed unusual and warranted further inquiry.
witness description: Pilot and co-pilot of R-29 aircraft
